p: The combined effects of climatic changes and future land use transformations will increase unsuitable habitats more than one can predict [ 60]. Our analysis suggested that P. orientalis has a broad adaptability under the current and future climates, but much of the suitable area might disappear due to land use transformations and humans exploitation for economic purpose. Practically the entire suitable habitat of P. orientalis is transected by or within the vicinity of populated places, and much of the suitable area for P. orientalis has already been converted into agriculture or urbanized. Studies are still needed to qualify the anthropogenic impacts on the adaptation to future climates for this wide-spread conifer tree.
